title: Interpret the Conditions
text: When the plane flies with the wind, the wind increases its speed and so the rate is $$120$$ + $$r$$.\nWhen the plane flies against the wind, the wind decreases its speed and the rate is $$120$$ - $$r$$.
speech: When the plane flies with the wind, the wind increases its speed and so the rate is , 120  +  r .\nWhen the plane flies against the wind, the wind decreases its speed and the rate is  120  -  r .

title: Set Up Equation For Problem
text: $$Distance=Rate Time$$. We can solve for Time and get $$Time=\frac{Distance}{Rate}$$. When flies with the wind, it takes $$\frac{200}{120+r}$$. When flies against the wind, it takes $$\frac{200}{120-r}$$. In total it takes $$4$$ hours. We can set up the equation as $$\frac{200}{120+r}+\frac{200}{120-r}=4$$.
speech: Distance is equal to, RateTime . We can solve for Time and get  Time, is equal to Distance over Rate . When flies with the wind, it takes , fraction, 200 over, 120 plus r,  . When flies against the wind, it takes , fraction, 200 over, 120 minus r,  . In total it takes  4  hours. We can set up the equation as , fraction, 200 over, 120 plus r,  plus, fraction, 200 over, 120 minus r,  is equal to 4 .

title: Solve For Unknown Using Quadratic Formula
text: $$\frac{200}{120+r}+\frac{200}{120-r}=4$$. Multiply both sides by the LCD which is $$\left(120+r\right) \left(120-r\right)$$. It turns the equation into $$200\left(120-r\right)+200\left(120+r\right)=4\left(120-r\right) \left(120+r\right)$$. We can further simplify it into $$4r^2=9600$$. Solve for $$r$$ and round it to the nearest tenth. If there is more than one answer, please enter it as (a,b) where $$a<b$$.

title: Final Answer
text: Since the wind speed can not be negative, we omit the negative answer. So the speed of the wind was $$49$$ mph.
speech: Since the wind speed can not be negative, we omit the negative answer. So the speed of the wind was  49  mph.
